raw_response: {"answer_index": 2, "answer_text": "C", "confidence": 10, "reasoning": "This patient has episodic headaches, palpitations, hypertension, and diaphoresis, classic for pheochromocytoma. Pheochromocytomas are catecholamine-secreting tumors derived from chromaffin cells of the adrenal medulla. On adrenal histology, the medulla is centrally located (region C in the typical adrenal gland histology slide), where chromaffin cells are found. Thus, the most likely cause is produced by cells in region C."}
